Articles.Content:
After two failed launches, my Griffin arrives in orbit, close to the orbital path of my Orion. Once I catch up to it, I will attempt docking with it, nd take the crew of it onboard the Orion. The Griffin will remain docked to it.

(Beauty shot of the Giffin above Kerbin in orbit)
Sweet. Let us know how it goes.
It's currently my third object currently in orbit. My first was the Venus MkII Comm. Satellite (the original VEnus Comm. Satellite couldn't get into orbit), and my Orion space station (of course).
That's a extremely high orbit. But good luck with the docking.
Hope you will complete the docking at your first attempt
I've found that high orbits make for easier docking. Sure, it can take longer, but you're dealing with lower relative speeds and have much more room for error.

The high orbit is due to an accidental burn when launching the Orion. The orbit burn made the periapsis too high, so I had to burn at the periapsis, resulting in a large orbit. At least it is different from most space station orbits.
